G5547.def: (literally: one who has been anointed) in the NT, titles for Jesus as the Messiah, but in many contexts, and especially without an article, Χριστός becomes a part of the name of Jesus; see {D:93.387})

G1161.def: a marker of an additive relation, but with the possible implication of some contrast

G1487.def: a marker of a condition, real or hypothetical, actual or contrary to fact

G5547.def: (literally: one who has been anointed) in the NT, titles for Jesus as the Messiah, but in many contexts, and especially without an article, Χριστός becomes a part of the name of Jesus; see {D:93.387})

G686.def: a marker of result as an inference from what has preceded (frequently used in questions and in the result clause of conditional sentences)

G3588.def: a reference to an entity, event, or state, clearly identified by the linguistic or non-linguistic context of the utterance{N:001}

G11.def: the patriarch of the Israelite nation and father of the faithful

G4690.def: the kernel part of fruit, usually grain

glosses: one who comes into possession of
G2818.def: (derivative of {L:κληρονομέω<SDBG:κληρονομέω:000000>}[a] ‘to gain as a possession,’ {D:57.131}) one who receives something as a gift

G2596.def: extension to a goal, normally down

G1860.def: (derivative of {L:ἐπαγγέλλομαι<SDBG:ἐπαγγέλλομαι:000000>}[a] ‘to promise,’ {D:33.286}) the content of what is promised{N:001}
